warning_note: ‚ö†Ô∏è This is a preliminary analysis and not a medical diagnosis. For clinical assessment, consult a specialist.
start_prompt: Start the analysis and the report will appear here.
tip1: Place the camera from the side view at a distance of 2.5‚Äì4 meters
tip2: Ensure good, even lighting and avoid bright backgrounds
tip3: Make sure the whole body appears within the frame while walking
tip4: Walk 6‚Äì10 steps at a steady pace
stride_placeholder: Start analysis to show step length symmetry between legs.
advice_ok: Movement is coordinated between legs, indicating good muscular balance.
advice_warn: May indicate muscle weakness or pain in the shorter-step leg. Clinical evaluation recommended.
info_desc_1: üìò Description: This chart compares the mean step length (horizontal distance between feet) of the right vs left side.
info_desc_2: A variation greater than 10% is considered abnormal and may indicate weakness or pain in one leg.
info_sources: Sources: Kirtley (2005) ‚Äì Clinical Gait Analysis; Bohannon (1997) ‚Äì Step Length Norms
placeholder_report: Start the analysis and the report will appear here.
file_not_selected: Upload a video or enable the camera first.
detector_not_ready: The analysis engine is not ready yet, please wait a few seconds and try again.
scan_qr: Scan the QR code to try the early version of the site.
notes_no_issues: ‚úÖ No clear indicators of issues ‚Äî this is a preliminary analysis only.
report_note_cadence_slow: May indicate muscle weakness or balance issues.
report_note_cadence_fast: May be related to tension or abnormal gait pattern.
report_note_trunk_comp: May indicate compensatory movement or weak core muscles.
report_note_symmetry: May indicate side-to-side strength difference or limb problem.
report_note_walking_slow: May indicate reduced functional capacity or balance issues.
report_note_walking_fast: May be associated with overexertion or abnormal gait.
